tr.td: If the woman has risk factors for developing pre-eclampsia, provide counselling to reduce risk of developing pre-eclampsia

ANC.DT.27 Pre-eclampsia risk counselling:
When: named-event: ANC.B6. Collect woman's profile & history
Then:
The woman is at risk of developing pre-eclampsia – provide counselling
If: applicability: ((((((("Number of fetuses" ≥ 2 ) OR ("Past pregnancy complications" = "Pre-eclampsia")) OR ("Past pregnancy complications" = "Eclampsia")) OR ("Past pregnancy complications" = "Convulsions")) OR ("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Autoimmune disease")) OR ("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Diabetes")) OR ("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Hypertension")) OR ("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Kidney disease") (Should Provide counselling on pre-eclampsia risk)
The woman is at risk of developing pre-eclampsia: provide counselling; prescribe aspirin 75 mg daily until delivery (starting at 12 weeks gestation) for pre-eclampsia risk
If: applicability: (((((((("Number of fetuses" ≥ 2 ) AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks)) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Pre-eclampsia") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Eclampsia") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Convulsions") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Autoimmune disease") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Diabetes") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Hypertension") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Kidney disease") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks)) (Should Provide counselling on pre-eclampsia risk 2)
Then:
Provide counselling on pre-eclampsia risk:
"Amount of daily aspirin prescribed until delivery" = 75 mg:
The woman is at risk of developing pre-eclampsia: provide counselling; prescribe aspirin 75 mg daily until delivery (starting at 12 weeks gestation) and ensure that she continues to take her daily calcium supplement of 1.5–2 g until delivery for pre-eclampsia risk
If: applicability: (((((((("Number of fetuses" ≥ 2) AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE)) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Pre-eclampsia") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Eclampsia") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Past pregnancy complications" = "Convulsions") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Autoimmune disease") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Diabetes") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Hypertension") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE))) OR (("Existing chronic health conditions" = "Kidney disease") AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 12 weeks) AND ("Population with low dietary calcium intake" = TRUE)) (Should Provide counselling on pre-eclampsia risk 3)
Then:
Provide counselling on pre-eclampsia risk:
"Amount of daily aspirin prescribed until delivery" = 75 mg:
1.5 g ≤ "Amount of calcium supplements provided" ≤ 2 g:
